document_title: Vaginitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
There are factors that increase the risk of developing vaginal infections, including:
Hormonal changes, which often occur when a woman becomes pregnant, uses birth control pills, enters premenopause/menopause, undergoes surgery to remove the ovaries...; Regular sexual activity, especially intercourse with multiple partners, intercourse without condom protection; Have a sexually transmitted infection; Use of antibiotics and steroids; Use spermicide to prevent pregnancy.; Diabetes.; Using products for private areas such as feminine hygiene solutions, vaginal sprays, vaginal deodorants...; Douche your vagina regularly.; Wearing wet or tight underwear; Use an intrauterine device (IUD) to prevent pregnancy.
subsection_data:
